summary: The document is a memorandum from Fredrick C. Wickham, Jr., the DO Focal Point for ARRB, to the Chief of the Historical Review Group, dated 11 December 1995. It details the DO's opposition to the release of specific information concerning ERTHYROID/3, a Nicaraguan interrogator, under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. The DO contends that disclosing ERTHYROID/3's identity and his unique relationship with the CIA could pose risks to his safety and jeopardize other unilateral relationships the CIA maintains with officers in liaison services.
key_findings: The DO opposes the release of the phrase 'a good KUBARK asset' to protect ERTHYROID/3's unilateral relationship with the CIA.
ERTHYROID/3 was dispatched to Mexico City to aid in the interrogation of Alvarado under the Samoza regime.
Disclosure of ERTHYROID/3's identity could endanger him and raise suspicions about other recruited officers in liaison services.
The document underscores the CIA's strategy of recruiting officers within liaison services for unilateral operations.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
